column1: In the case of The Queen Vs. K.A. Piyadasa 67 NLR 481;
In a trial before the Supreme Court an eye-witness P, who was called by
the  prosecution,  admitted  that  portions  of  the  statement  which  he  had
made  to  the  police  were  false.  At  the  end  of  his  re-examination,  and
before  two  other  eye-witnesses  K  and  N  were  called,  the  trial  judge
addressing him said, “You will stand down and remain in fiscal’s custody.
